'''Galweg''' was a [[Gnome]], one of the [[Rodothlim]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name=Gal>{{LT2|II}}, pp. 82-3</ref>

== History ==
Galweg was the father of [[Failivrin]], who fell in love with [[Túrin]] when he and his friend [[Flinding]] lived in the [[Nargothrond|caverns of the Rodothlim]],<ref group=note>The name ''Nargothrond'' did not yet appear at this point in the legendarium.</ref><ref>{{LT2|IIn}}, p. 123</ref> ruled by [[Orodreth]]. He was fond of Túrin, and they often aided one another.<ref name=Gal/>

Galweg was killed during [[Melko]]'s [[Fall of Nargothrond#Other versions of the legendarium|attack on the Rodothlim]].<ref>{{LT2|II}}, p. 84</ref> His dwelling was later occupied by [[Mîm]] the [[Dwarves|Dwarf]], who was in turn further slain by [[Úrin]], Túrin's father.<ref>{{LT2|II}}, pp. 113-4</ref>

==Etymology==
While ''Galweg'' is not directly glossed, in [[Gnomish]] ''gal'' means "shine (golden, as the Sun)"<ref>{{PE|11}}</ref>{{rp|37}} and "weg" is a masculine suffix.

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In ''[[The Lay of the Children of Húrin]]'', written not long after ''The Book of Lost Tales'', Failivrin's father became Orodreth, and the character of Galweg had disappeared entirely.<ref>{{LB|1d}}, p. 91</ref>
